title: Implement incremental file-level reindexing
description:
**Goal**: Only reindex files that have actually changed instead of reindexing entire repositories.

**What we're accomplishing**: Currently when commits change, entire repos are reindexed. File-level tracking would:
- Detect which specific files changed between commits
- Only parse/chunk/embed modified files
- Remove old chunks and add new ones
- Reduce reindex time by 90%+ for typical changes

**Impact**: Near-instant reindexing for small changes. A 10-minute full reindex becomes 5-10 seconds for a few file changes.

**Implementation**:
- Track per-file commit hashes or modification times
- Use git diff to detect changed files
- Implement chunk deletion by file_path
- Update only changed files in ChromaDB
- Handle file deletions and renames
- Test with various git scenarios

title: Test incremental indexing with various git scenarios
